Name: Abilities
Description: Innate and developed aptitudes that facilitate the acquisition of knowledge and skills to carry out expected work.

Name: Cognitive Abilities
Description: Abilities that influence the acquisition and application of knowledge in performing various mental processes at work.

Name: Information Ordering
Description: The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations). This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Categorization Flexibility
Description: The ability to generate or use different sets of rules for combining or grouping things in different ways. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Deductive Reasoning
Description: The ability to apply general rules to produce logical answers for specific problems. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Inductive Reasoning
Description: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions, which includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Fluency of Ideas
Description: The ability to come up with multiple ideas about a topic. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Problem Identification
Description: The ability to identify an existing or potential problem. It is not about solving the problem, but only about recognizing its presence. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Numerical Ability
Description: The ability to carry out arithmetical processes accurately such as addition, subtraction, multiplication or division. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Mathematical Reasoning
Description: The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Memorizing
Description: The ability to remember information such as words, numbers, pictures, or procedures. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Multitasking
Description: The ability to shift back and forth between two or more activities or sources of information during the same time period (such as speech, sounds, touch, or other sources). This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Pattern Identification
Description: The ability to identify or detect a known pattern such as a figure, object, word, or sound that is hidden in other information or material. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Pattern Organization Speed
Description: The ability to quickly combine and organize information into meaningful patterns. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Perceptual Speed
Description: The ability to compare, quickly and accurately, similarities and differences among sets of letters, numbers, objects, pictures, or patterns. The things to be compared may be presented at the same time, one after the other, or with a remembered object. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Spatial Orientation
Description: The ability to know your location in relation to the environment or know where objects are in relation to you. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Spatial Visualization
Description: The ability to think visually about geometric forms, comprehend the two-dimensional representation of three-dimensional objects and recognize the relationships resulting from the movement of objects in space. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Verbal Ability
Description: The ability to understand the meaning, precise use, associated ideas, and relationships of spoken words; and to use them in the proper context when presenting information or ideas. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Written Comprehension
Description: The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in written form. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Written Expression
Description: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing and adapting the writing style to the audience so that they can understand. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Selective Attention
Description: The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Form Perception
Description: The ability to perceive pertinent detail in objects and graphic material; to make visual comparisons and discriminations and to see slight differences in shapes and shadings of figures and widths and lengths of lines. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: General Learning Ability
Description: The ability to "catch on" or understand instructions and underlies principles to reason and make judgments. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Physical Abilities
Description: Abilities to perform physical activities that require strength, endurance, flexibility, balance or coordination.

Name: Trunk Strength
Description: The ability to exert your abdominal and lower back muscles to support part of the body repeatedly or continuously over time without "giving out" or fatiguing. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Static Strength
Description: The ability to exert muscle force to lift, push, pull, carry, or transfer objects. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Dynamic Strength
Description: The ability to exert muscle force repeatedly or continuously over time. This involves muscular endurance and resistance to muscle fatigue. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Explosive Strength
Description: The ability to exert short bursts of muscle force to propel oneself (as in jumping or sprinting), to throw an object, or to apply force with a tool. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Multi-Limb Coordination
Description: The ability to coordinate two or more limbs, such as two arms, two legs, or one leg and one arm, while sitting, standing, or lying down. It does not involve performing the activities while the whole body is in motion. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Gross Body Coordination
Description: The ability to coordinate the movement of your arms, legs, and torso together when the whole body is in motion. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Gross Body Equilibrium
Description: The ability to keep or regain your body balance or stay upright when in an unstable position. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Body Flexibility
Description: The ability to bend, stretch, twist, or reach with your body, arms, and/or legs. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Dynamic Flexibility
Description: The ability to quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out with your body, arms, and/or legs. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Stamina
Description: The ability to perform intense physical activities over long periods without becoming winded or out of breath. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Psychomotor Abilities
Description: Abilities needed to manipulate and control objects.

Name: Arm-Hand Steadiness
Description: The ability to keep your hand and arm steady while moving or holding them in one position. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Finger Dexterity
Description: The ability to make precisely coordinated movements of the fingers of one or both hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble small objects. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Manual Dexterity
Description: The ability to move your hand, your hand together with your arm, or your two hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble objects or tools. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Motor Coordination
Description: The ability to coordinate eyes, hands and fingers accurately to respond with precise movements. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Rate Control
Description: The ability to time your movements or the movement of a piece of equipment in anticipation of changes in the speed and/or direction of a moving object. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Control of Settings
Description: The ability to adjust the controls of a machine or a vehicle to exact positions. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Multi-Signal Response
Description: The ability to choose quickly between one or more movements with the hand, finger, or foot in response to the appearance of two or more different signals such as lights, sounds, or images. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Reaction Time
Description: The ability to respond quickly with one or more limbs to a stimulus such as noise, light or image. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Speed of Limb Movement
Description: The ability to quickly move the arms and legs. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Finger-Hand-Wrist Motion
Description: The ability to make fast, simple, and repeated movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Sensory Abilities
Description: Abilities needed to perform activities that require visual, auditory, tactile, olfactory or speech perception.

Name: Auditory Attention
Description: The ability to give full attention on a single source of sound in the presence of other distracting sounds. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Hearing Sensitivity
Description: The ability to detect or distinguish the differences between sounds in terms of pitch and volume. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Speech Clarity
Description: The ability to articulate and pronounce words clearly, so others can understand you when you speak. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Speech Recognition
Description: The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Sound Localization
Description: The ability to identify the direction, origin and distance from which a sound comes. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Far Vision
Description: The ability to see details of objects and people at a distance. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Near Vision
Description: The ability to see details at close range. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Peripheral Vision
Description: The ability to see objects, people, or their movement in the peripheral field of vision when looking ahead. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Depth Perception
Description: The ability to discern which of several objects is closer or farther away from you, or to estimate the distance between you and an object. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Glare Tolerance
Description: The ability to see objects or people, in the presence of glare or bright lighting. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Night Vision
Description: The ability to see under low light conditions. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Colour Perception
Description: The ability to match or detect differences or similarities between colours, including shades of colour and brightness. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Smell
Description: The ability to perceive odours through the nose. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Taste
Description: The ability to recognize or verify a particular flavor of a substance by tasting it. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Touch
Description: The ability to acquire information about the environment through skin contact. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level level on a scale of 1-5

Name: Personal Attributes
Description: Personal characteristics that are innate and developed through the social context and personal experiences to which the individual is exposed. These qualities influence the way one is and does things and are considered valuable assets for work performance.

Name: Social Traits
Description: The personal characteristics related to the positive attitudes one has toward other people that most often lead to positive relationships.

Name: Leadership
Description: The quality of leading others towards a common goal by guiding, influencing, and inspiring them. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Charisma
Description: The quality of possessing charm, attracting and arousing the interest, attention, or admiration of others through speeches, attitudes, temperament, or actions. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Concern for Others
Description: The quality of having empathy towards others' feelings and needs and being understanding and helpful. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Collaboration
Description: The quality of contributing and working cooperatively while being supportive and inclusive of others to achieve a common goal. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Service Orientation
Description: The quality of actively looking for ways to help, serve, or assist others. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Trust in Others
Description: The quality of establishing and maintaining a relationship of trust with the people around you. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Social Orientation
Description: The quality of seeking to work with others and relating to them on the job. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Self-Improvement
Description: The personal characteristics related to the improvement of one's knowledge, status, or character by one's own efforts.

Name: Adaptability
Description: The quality of adapting oneself to expected or unexpected changes and different situations while continuing to achieve past or renewed goals. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Self-Control
Description: The quality of maintaining composure, keeping emotions in check, controlling anger, and avoiding aggressive behaviour, even in very difficult situations. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Stress Tolerance
Description: The quality of being able to remain calm, without being carried away by stress situations and to deal effectively with such situations. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Tolerance of Ambiguity
Description: The quality of being able to function in an environment where there is uncertainty, unpredictability, conflicting directions or multiple demands and to approach these situations as challenges to improve. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Resilience
Description: The quality of recovering from difficulties or changes, one has had to face, to bounce back and then move forward. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Self-Awareness
Description: The quality of being aware of own personality, character, and feelings including strengths, weaknesses, thoughts, behaviors, beliefs, motivation, and emotions. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Self-Confidence
Description: The quality of trust in one’s ability to achieve goals, believing in one’s potential and abilities, and knowing that one is capable of achieving goals when facing challenges. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Active Learning
Description: Pro-actively looking to understand the implications of new information in the current and changing workplace. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Continuous Learning
Description: Wanting to continuously develop and improve one's skills, abilities and knowledge in order to adapt to changes and work effectively. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Results-Based Attributes
Description: The personal characteristics related to the drivers around brining things to completion.

Name: Achievement
Description: The quality of establishing and maintaining goals and exerting all effort to accomplish them successfully. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Initiative
Description: The quality of taking on responsibilities and challenges, proposing, doing or organizing something by oneself without being prompted by others. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Motivation
Description: The quality of being driven by interest, need, reason or reward to achieve something or to reach a set outcome. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Perseverance
Description: The quality of voluntarily and deliberately putting forth the effort required by a task or activity despite difficulties, failure or obstacles. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Risk-Taking
Description: The quality of being willing to make a risky choice, with regard for the consequences, in the hope of achieving a desired results or benefit in return. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Competitiveness
Description: The quality of being driven by a deep desire to be as good as or better than others to perform well in a comparable context. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Independence
Description: The quality of developing one's own way of doing things, guiding oneself with little or no supervision, and depending on oneself to get things done. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Professional Conscientiousness
Description: The personal characteristics related to the drivers around fulfilling commitments.

Name: Reliable
Description: The quality of being dependable and respectful of commitments. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Integrity
Description: The quality of being honest, ethical, and authentic. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Being Responsible
Description: The quality of taking responsibility for one’s own actions and the actions of a group. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Dynamic Thinking
Description: The personal characteristics related to bubbling ideas and critical thinking.

Name: Having Judgement
Description: The quality of forming an opinion consistent with common sense based on an assessment of an event or fact. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Analytical Thinking
Description: The quality of analyzing information and using logic to address issues and problems. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Attention to Detail
Description: The quality of being meticulous in the execution of tasks. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Creativity
Description: The quality of coming up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop original ways to solve a problem. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Innovativeness
Description: The quality of alternative thinking to develop new products or services to make improvement or to develop a new approach. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Entrepreneurial Spirit
Description: The quality of identifying and seizing opportunities and moving from idea to achievement. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Interests
Description: Preferences for work environments and outcomes.

Name: Holland Codes
Description: Holland codes, also referred to as RIASEC codes, refer to John L. Holland's six interest personality types. Each of them are characterized by the dominant activities, preferences and interests most often expected.

Name: Realistic
Description: Realistic occupations are characterized by the dominance of activities that entail the explicit, ordered or systematic manipulation of objects, tools, machines and animals. Many of these occupations do not involve a lot of paperwork or working closely with others.

Name: Investigative
Description: Investigative occupations are characterized by the dominance of activities that entail the observation and systematic or creative investigation of physical, biological, or cultural phenomena. These occupations require an extensive amount of thinking and frequently involve working with ideas, searching for facts and figuring out problems mentally.

Name: Artistic
Description: Artistic occupations are characterized by the dominance of activities that entail artistic expression to create, compose or produce visual, performing, literary or applied art. These occupations frequently involve working with forms, designs and patterns and often require self-expression and the accomplishment of work without following a clear set of rules.

Name: Social
Description: Social occupations are characterized by the dominance of activities that entail the interaction with others to inform, train, aid, develop, cure, or enlighten.  These occupations often involve helping or providing service to others, teaching, working or communicating with people.

Name: Enterprising
Description: Enterprising occupations are characterized by the dominance of action-oriented activities to attain organizational or self-interest goals.  They frequently involve starting up and carrying out projects, influencing, leading or mobilizing people, making decisions, and sometimes require risk taking and dealing with business.

Name: Conventional
Description: Conventional occupations are characterized by the dominance of activities that entail following sets of procedures and routines. These activities may include systematic manipulation of data, such as keeping records, filing materials, reproducing materials, organizing written and numerical data according to a prescribed plan, and operating business and data processing. They often require following a clear line of authority and usually involve working with data and details more than with ideas.

Name: Skills
Description: Developed capabilities that an individual must have to be effective in a job, role, function, task or duty.

Name: Foundational Skills
Description: Developed capabilities that facilitate the more rapid acquisition of other skills and knowledge.

Name: Oral Communication: Active Listening
Description: The capability to give full attention to what other people are saying, take time to understand the points being made, ask questions as appropriate, and not interrupt at inappropriate times. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Oral Communication: Oral Comprehension
Description: The capability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Oral Communication: Oral Expression
Description: The capability to talk to others to convey information effectively. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Reading Comprehension
Description: The capability to understand written information presented through words, sentences, paragraphs, symbols, and images in work-related documents. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Writing
Description: The capability to communicate in writing by using written words, sentences, paragraphs, symbols, and images and adapted for the needs of the audience. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Numeracy
Description: The capability to understand, use and report numbers and other mathematical information presented through words, numbers, symbols, and graphics. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Digital Literacy
Description: The capability to understand and use digital devices and tools to obtain, exchange, create or process digital information in a secure manner. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Analytical Skills
Description: Developed capability that people need to process information and data logically to produce useable results.

Name: Critical Thinking
Description: The capability to use logic and reasoning to question, discern, interpret and analyze various types of information to form an evidence-based conclusion or judgment. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Learning and Teaching Strategies
Description: The capability to select and use training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Decision Making
Description: The capability to analyze information among a set of alternatives, to evaluate potential outcome and choose the most appropriate solutions to achieve a predetermined objective. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Evaluation
Description: The capability to systematically assess products, services or processes using measurable indicators with the goal of ensuring or improving performance. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Requirements Analysis
Description: The capability to analyze needs and product requirements to create a design. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Systems Analysis
Description: The capability to determine how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Researching and Investigating
Description: The capability to conduct studies and to examine information and data to increase knowledge, understand facts, find causes, test hypotheses and draw conclusions or make recommendations. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Problem Solving
Description: The capability to identify problems and review related information to develop solutions or feasible options to achieve the desired end state. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Technical Skills
Description: Developed capabilities that relate to the practical or mechanical side of an activity, the application of a set of technical processes and required know-how.

Name: Equipment and Tool Selection
Description: The capability to choose between two or more types of tools, equipment or, machinery to perform a job. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Preventative Maintenance
Description: The capability to perform maintenance on equipment, devices, building or machinery to keep them in functional and to prevent damage or failures. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Setting Up
Description: The capability to set up, adjust, install and assemble equipment, machines, parts or to prepare them for their functioning and use. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Operation and Control
Description: The capability to maneuver and control operations of equipment, machines, vehicles or systems. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Operation Monitoring of Machinery and Equipment
Description: The capability to watch gauges, dials, digital displays or other indicators to ensure a machine or piece of equipment is working according to specifications. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Troubleshooting
Description: The capability to determine causes of operating errors in equipment, machinery, or technological systems and decide how to resolve the issues. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Repairing
Description: The capability to replace, restore or adjust  defective or deficient components in equipment, machines, and technical systems and test for function, appearance, operation and safety. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Quality Control Testing
Description: The capability to conduct tests or inspections of prototypes, products, services, or processes to ensure their quality. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Product Design
Description: The capacity to design and develop layouts for the construction of objects, equipment, machinery, structures, or engineering systems (excluding software and hardware). This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Digital Production
Description: The capacity to design, develop, adapt, or integrate hardware, software applications, electronic devices or digital technologies while adhering to cybersecurity standards. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Resource Management Skills
Description: Developed capabilities to plan, organize, monitor or control the resources to achieve goals.

Name: Management of Financial Resources
Description: The capability to plan, organize, direct, control or monitor financial resources and activities and account for the use of theses resources to ensure their utilization are conform to the objectives and purposes. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Management of Material Resources
Description: The capability to plan and manage the purchase, inventory, warehousing, transportation, or distribution of products or materials and their use. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Management of Personnel Resources
Description: The capability to recruit, train, motivate, develop and direct employees, identify the best person for the tasks to be performed and establish their work objectives in relation to the objectives of the organization. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Operational Planning
Description: The capability to determine phases and steps, define activities and tasks, and establish schedules to complete objectives on time and within budget. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Projecting Outcomes
Description: The capability to estimate, predict and forecast results and outcomes of an action or a series of actions based on data and indicators. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Risk Management
Description: The capability to identify and assess risks and determine procedures to be followed to reduce or avoid their impact. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Strategic Planning
Description: The capability set goals according to organization’s needs, to develop strategies, and action plans to achieve. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Time Management
Description: The capability to manage one's own time and the time of others. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Monitoring
Description: The capability to monitor and assess the performance of yourself, other individuals or the organization to make improvements or take corrective action. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Change Management and Crisis Management Skills
Change Management
Description: The capability to plan and implement strategies for effecting change, communicate the effects of change, and provide guidance and support to those affected by change. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Crisis Management
Description: The capability to establish a response plan for emergencies, to apply it and adapt it to situations while limiting the impact on people, customers, employees and the organisation. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Interpersonal Skills
Description: Developed capabilities used to work with people to achieve goals.

Name: Interpersonal Skills
Description: Developed capabilities used to work with people to achieve goals.

Name: Coordinating
Description: The capability to organize people or groups by adjusting activities in relation to others' activities so that they work effectively as a whole. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Instructing
Description: The capability to teach others knowledge, or how to do something. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Negotiating
Description: The capability to participate in, or facilitate communication between parties, in order to resolve differences, and reach a mutually acceptable or viable  agreement. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Persuading
Description: The capability to convince others to change their minds, beliefs, intentions or behaviours. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Social Perceptiveness
Description: The capability to be aware of others' reactions, unspoken communication, body language cues and feelings and discern the reasons behind their behaviours. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Cross-Cultural Sensitivity
Description: The capability to communicate, interact and work appropriately with people from different cultural backgrounds, in recognition that diversity is being both between and within cultural groups and can be expressed in customs, values, and ways of thinking and acting. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Managing Conversation
Description: The capability to lead and facilitate dialogue between two or more people. This descriptor is measured by proficiency level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Knowledge
Description: Organized sets of principles and practices used for the execution of tasks and activities within a particular domain.

Name: Administration and Management
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to administration and management domains.

Name: Accounting
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods and practices for budgeting, storing, tracking, controlling, analyzing, and reporting on financial transactions. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Business Management
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles and practices of managing business operations such as strategic planning, resource allocation, production management, and coordination of people and activities. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Clerical
Description: Knowledge of administrative concepts, principles, methods, procedures and practices for the functioning of the daily office operations. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Finance
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods and practices related to financial operations, systems and institutions. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Human Resources and Labour relations
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, procedures and practices for personnel recruitment, selection, hiring, training, deploying, compensation and benefits, labour relations and negotiation, and personnel information systems. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Sale and Marketing
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, practices and tools for determining consumer behaviour and needs, developing business opportunities and promoting and selling products and services. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Client Service
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, and practices of providing services and support to satisfy clients' requirements and needs. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Communication
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to communication domains.

Name: Communications and Media
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods and techniques of creation, production, distribution or dissemination of written, oral, audiovisual or visual communications. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Education
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to education domains.

Name: Teaching
Description: Knowledge of the concepts, principles, methods and practices of instructing individuals and groups, designing educational curriculum and measuring learning outcome. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Training, Mentoring and Coaching
Description: Knowledge of concepts and principles of learning and readiness to learn, and of methods for guiding, advising, directing and supporting career or personal goals for the individuals or groups to gain experience and improve competencies. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Health and Wellbeing
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to health and wellbeing domains.

Name: Hospitality
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques and tools or equipment for managing facilities and providing food, accommodation or tourism services with the focus on client experience. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Mental Health
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods, and procedures for assessment, diagnosis, treatment, rehabilitation, counseling or guidance to address neurological and cognitive processes, behaviours, and disorders or to maintain balanced mental health and well-being. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Personal Services
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques and tools for providing services of personal nature related to body care, childcare and other in-home services. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Physical Health
Description: Knowledge of concepts and principles of the human anatomy, organic systems, biomedical sciences, genetics, and of procedures, techniques and tools needed to diagnose and treat injuries and diseases, to restore and maintain physical health by the prevention and treatment. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Recreation, Leisure and Fitness
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, practices, and equipment for physical fitness and for managing and providing recreational, leisure and fitness program or services. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Veterinarian and Animal Care
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, practices, techniques and tools for the prevention, care, diagnostics, and treatment of diseases, disorders and injuries, and the maintenance of wellbeing of animals. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Law, Government and Safety
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to law, government and safety.

Name: Military
Description: Knowledge of organisations, structures, practices and strategies related to defence, security, intelligence and peacekeeping missions. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Law
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, functioning and processes of the provincial-territorial, federal or international legal systems for the establishment, implementation and application of laws, legal codes and documents, and court procedures. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Public Affairs and Government Relations
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, processes, and functioning of governments and political systems for the establishment and implementation of policies, rules, regulations, and executive orders. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Public Safety and Security
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, regulations, procedures and practices of public safety and security operations and systems for the protection of people, data and properties. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Logistics, Design and Evaluation
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to logistics, design and evaluation domains.

Name: Manufacturing, Processing and Production
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods and techniques of production and transformation, including manual and mechanical processes. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Logistics
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, infrastructures and processes for planning, organizing and coordinating the transportation of people and animals or for the acquisition, transportation, and storage of goods and resources. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Performance Measurement
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods, practices and strategies of monitoring the development, delivery and quality of products, programs or services. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Technical Design
Description: Knowledge of technical design concepts, principles, methods, techniques, and tools involved in the creation and production of technical plans, blueprints, drawings or models. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Natural Resources
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to natural resources domains.

Name: Agriculture and Horticulture
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, materials, and equipment for planting, growing, harvesting, storing or preserving plants and plant-sourced food products. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Forestry
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, materials, and equipment for sourcing, processing, and managing harvested forestry resources, and monitoring and preserving sustainable forestry resources. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Geological Resources
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, materials, and equipment for sourcing, processing, managing, monitoring or preserving mineral and metals resources. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Livestock, Farm Animals & Wildlife
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, materials, and equipment for sourcing, raising, fishing, hunting, managing, monitoring, or preserving stored sustainable animal resources and  wildlife conservation. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Water Resources
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, materials, and equipment for sourcing, processing, managing, monitoring or preserving water resources such as rivers, lakes, oceans, and underground aquifers. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Physical Sciences
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to physical sciences domains.

Name: Biology
Description: Knowledge of concepts and principles of living organisms including their structure, function, growth, origin, evolution, distribution and classification and their interdependencies and interactions with each other and the environment, as well as  safe and ethical handling methods and techniques. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Chemistry
Description: Knowledge of the composition, structure, and properties of chemical substances including their interactions, transformations and use, as well as the production techniques, risk factors, and disposal methods. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Geoscience
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods, and techniques for understanding material quality, physical characteristics, composition, structure, and natural systems, and the evolution of earth, ocean, and atmosphere phenomena. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Physics
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, fundamental properties, and laws that govern space, time, energy and matter and of equipment and methods required to study and apply the interactions of objects including atoms, particles and celestial bodies. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Socioeconomic Systems
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to socioeconomics domains.

Name: Arts
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles and techniques of artistic expression required to create, compose or produce visual, applied, performing or literary art. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Economics
Description: Knowledge of concepts and principles of the production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services and the methods of analysis including simulation and forecasting techniques. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Humanities
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods for understanding human social interaction and structures, and events throughout time and their effects on civilizations, cultures and environment. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Library, Conservation, and Heritage
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, and tools in the classification, storage, retrieval, display and management of documentation and records in various media, museum artifacts or works of fine art. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Theology and Philosophy
Description: Knowledge of concepts and principles of religious and philosophical systems, and of fundamental questioning of existence, reason, values, ethics, ways of thinking, customs, practices and their impact on individuals, human culture and society. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Technology, Electrical, Material and Mechanical
Description: Organized set of principles and practices relating to technology, electrical, material and mechanical.

Name: The Technology, Electrical, Material and Mechanical
Building and Construction
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods, materials and tools involved in the construction, maintenance and repair of houses, buildings, or infrastructures such as highways and roads. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Computer, Technology and Information Systems
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, processes, techniques, and tools for technological and digital systems, devices and products, such as hardware or software development, assembling, programming, use, troubleshooting or maintenance. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Electrical and Electronics
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques, and tools applied for the development, use, repair and maintenance of electronic and electrical products and devices. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Mechanics and Machinery
Description: Knowledge of parts, standards, and functioning of machines, vehicles, equipment or tools, and techniques used for their repair or maintenance. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Telecommunications
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, processes, techniques and tools of the transmission of information via wire, radio, optical fiber or other electromagnetic system for the use, repair, maintenance, control, or operation of telecommunications systems. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Vehicle, Machinery and Equipment Operations
Description: Knowledge of the parts and functioning of vehicles, machinery or equipment, and of techniques and practices for their safe and efficient use. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Foundational Knowledge
Description: Organized set of principles and practices that are fundamental to the acquisition of new knowledge.

Name: Languages
Description: Knowledge of vocabulary, grammar structure and rules, spelling, and pronunciation of words in one or both official languages, Indigenous languages, and non-official languages. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Mathematics
Description: Knowledge of concepts, principles, methods, and applications of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, trigonometry, differential and integral calculus, probability, and statistics. This descriptor is measured by knowledge level on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Work Context
Description: Physical, environmental, and social factors that influence the nature of work.

Name: Structural Job Characteristics
Description: The components that define the structural aspect of the job.

Name: Consequence of Error
Description: The impact on outcomes of a mistake, which was not readily correctable, made by the worker. This descriptor is measured by degree of consequence of error on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Freedom to Make Decisions
Description: The job allows the worker to make decisions without supervision. This descriptor is measured by degree of freedom to make decisions on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Frequency of Decision Making
Description: The job requires the worker to make decisions that affect other people, the financial resources, and/or the image and reputation of the organization.

Name: Impact of Decisions
Description: The impact on the organization or colleagues of the decisions made by the worker (a decision should be understood as a conclusion or resolution reached after consideration). This descriptor is measured by degree of impact on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Automation
Description: The job requires operation, manipulation or handling of automated systems, processes or machines. This descriptor is measured by degree of automation on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Precision
Description: The job requires the worker to be exact or accurate. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Structured versus Unstructured Work
Description: The extent to which the job is structured for the worker, rather than allowing the worker to determine tasks, priorities, and goals. This descriptor is measured by degree of freedom to determine tasks and priorities on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Tasks Repetition
Description: The job requires repetitive tasks in the performance of work. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Pace Determined by Speed of Equipment
Description: The job requires maintaining pace with the speed of the equipment, machines, or computers. This does not refer to always being occupied while in the position. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Time Pressure
Description: The job requires working under pressure, meeting strict deadlines or dealing with competing priorities. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Type of Work Schedules
Description: The type of schedule usually required for the job. This descriptor is measured by regular, irregular, or seasonal on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Work Week Duration
Description: Number of hours typically worked over a period of 7 days. This descriptor is measured by number of hours on a scale of 1-3.

Name: Competition
Description: The job requires to compete against co-workers or to be aware of competitive pressure between them or between businesses within the same industry. This descriptor is measured by degree of competition on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Physical Work Environment
Description: The physical surroundings in which the worker performs their job.

Name: Dangerous Locations
Description: The job requires working in locations that are inherently treacherous and are potential sources of injury. Such work locations include among others, construction sites, underground sites, erected support structures, and marine environments.

Name: Fire, Steam, Hot Surfaces
Description: The job requires being exposed to fire (rather than being exposed to flammable substances that may ignite), to emissions of steam or to intensely hot surfaces that are potential sources of injury.

Name: Flying Particles, Falling Objects
Description: The job requires being exposed to flying particles and falling objects or materials in the work environment that pose the risk of bodily injury. Flying particles refer to particles such as wood chips, metal particles, and rock chips generated by the handling, crushing, grinding, rapid impact, or explosion of materials.

Name: Hazardous Conditions
Description: The job requires being exposed to conditions that involves risks of accidents such as high voltage electricity, flammable material, or explosives. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Hazardous Equipment, Machinery, Tools
Description: The job requires working near or with equipment, instruments, machinery, or power/hand tools that may be a potential source of accident or injury.

Name: High Places
Description: The job requires being exposed to elevated places such as poles, scaffolding, catwalks, or ladders longer than two meters in length. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Radiation
Description: The job requires being exposed to ionizing radiation such as X-rays and radioactive substances or non-ionizing radiation such as radio frequencies and infrared, ultraviolet or visible light that may affect health adversely. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Cramped Work Space, Awkward Positions
Description: The job requires working in confined space that requires getting into uncomfortable positions.

Name: Skin Injury
Description: The job requires being exposed to the risks of minor burns, cuts, bites, or stings. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: In an Enclosed Vehicle or Equipment
Description: The job requires working in a closed vehicle or equipment (e.g., car, truck or heavy equipment). This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: In an Open Vehicle or Equipment
Description: The job requires working in an open vehicle or equipment (e.g., tractor). This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Indoors, Environmentally Controlled
Description: The job requires working inside a building with controlled temperature and humidity conditions. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Indoors, Not Environmentally Controlled
Description: The job requires working inside a building where the temperature and humidity are not controlled (e.g., warehouse without heat). This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and in duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Outside, Exposed to Weather
Description: The job requires working outdoors and being subject to variations in weather conditions and seasonal weather patterns. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Outside, Under Cover
Description: The job requires working outdoors, protected from variations in weather conditions and seasonal weather patterns by a covered space (e.g., structure with roof but no walls). This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Physical Proximity
Description: The job requires performing tasks while being physically close to other people. This descriptor is measured by physical distance from others on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Biological Agents
Description: The job requires being exposed to bacteria, viruses and fungi that may cause illness due to direct or indirect contact. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Dangerous Chemical Substances
Description: The job requires being exposed to contaminants, such as pollutants, gases or dust, through inhalation, ingestion, or contact with skin. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Vibration
Description: The job requires being exposed to oscillating or quivering motion of the body while performing tasks. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Sound and Noise
Description: The job requires being exposed to sound and noise levels that are distracting or uncomfortable, regardless of the equipment used by the workers. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Extremely Bright or Inadequate Lighting
Description: The job requires working in extremely bright or inadequate lighting conditions. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Extreme Temperatures
Description: The job requires being exposed to very hot (above 32.2 °C) or very cold (below 0 °C) temperatures. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Odours
Description: The job requires being exposed to noxious, intense or prolonged odours.

Name: Specialized Safety Equipment
Description: The job requires wearing specialized protective or safety equipment such as breathing apparatus, safety harness, full protection suits, or radiation protection. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Standard Safety Equipment
Description: The job requires wearing common protective or safety equipment such as safety shoes, glasses, gloves, hard hats, or life jackets. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Physical Demands
Description: The physical activities the job requires the worker to do.

Name: Bending or Twisting the Body
Description: The job requires leaning forwards or backwards or moving the body torsionally. This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Climbing
Description: The job requires going up and down ladders, scaffolds, or poles. This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Crawling
Description: The job requires moving in a prone position, with the body resting on or close to the ground, on the hands and knees.

Name: Crouching
Description: The job requires powering the body stance by bending the legs.

Name: Handling Material Manually
Description: The job requires using your hands to handle, control, or feel objects, tools, or controls (excluding mouse and keyboard). This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Keeping or Regaining Balance
Description: The job requires maintaining your body in a steady position or recovering balance. This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Kneeling
Description: The job requires positioning the body so that one or both knees rest on the floor.

Name: Making Repetitive Motions
Description: The job requires repeating the same movement. This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Sitting
Description: The job requires being in a position where the body weight is supported by the buttocks. This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Standing
Description: The job requires maintaining an upright position supported by one’s feet. This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Walking and Running
Description: The job requires lifting and setting down each foot in turn in order to move forward at a certain pace. This descriptor is measured by duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Reaching
Description: The job requires extending one or both arms to grasp or touch a person or an object.

Name: Stooping
Description: The job requires standing or walking with an inclination of the head, body, or shoulders.

Name: Keyboarding
Description: The job requires using a panel of keys for typing on an electronic device or computer.

Name: Carrying
Description: The job requires holding things while moving.

Name: Lifting
Description: The job requires raising an object using the hands and arms.

Name: Pulling
Description: The job requires taking hold of an object to move it toward oneself.

Name: Pushing
Description: The job requires exerting force in order to move an object forward.

Name: Speaking
Description: The job requires conveying information in spoken language.

Name: Visual Acuity
Description: The job requires distinguishing fine details in things or in the environment.

Name: Interpersonal Relations
Description: The human interactions required to perform the job.

Name: Conflict Situations
Description: The job requires being confronted with disputes or disagreements with or between customers, employees, or other parties. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Contact with Others
Description: The job requires being in contact with others (face-to-face, by telephone, or otherwise) to perform tasks. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and in duration on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Coordinating or Leading Others
Description: The job requires providing guidance or direction to co-workers or subordinates in accomplishing work activities. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Deal With External Customers
Description: The job requires working with members outside of the organization, including clients and the public. This descriptor is measured by importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Work with Work Group or Team
Description: The job requires working with others in a group or team. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5 and in importance on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Deal with Physically Aggressive People
Description: The job requires dealing with individuals that have violent behaviour. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Dealing With Unpleasant or Angry People
Description: The job requires dealing with disagreeable, furious, or discourteous individuals. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Electronic Mail
Description: The job requires the use of an electronic communication device to send and receive messages. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Face-to-Face Discussions
Description: The job requires having in-person discussions with individuals or teams. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Written Communications
Description: The job requires producing administrative or creative written communications. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Public Speaking
Description: The job requires delivering speeches to an audience (a minimum of five persons). This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Telephone
Description: The job requires communicating with others by using a telephone or hand-held radios. This descriptor is measured by frequency on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Videoconference
Description: The job requires using videoconference software to participate in meetings and conversations.

Name: Responsibility for Outcomes and Results of Other Workers
Description: The job requires assuming the responsibility for the end product and effects of other workers’ work. This descriptor is measured by degree of responsibility on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Responsible for Others' Health and Safety
Description: The job requires ensuring the health, safety and security of others. This descriptor is measured by degree of responsibility on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Work Activities
Description: General types of work-related activities.

Name: Information-Oriented Activities
Description: Information and data management and processing activities that are necessary to meet the requirements of the job.

Name: Looking for and Receiving Job-Related Information
Getting Information
Description: Observing, receiving, or obtaining information from all relevant sources. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Monitoring Processes, Materials, or Surroundings
Description: Tracking and reviewing information from materials, events, or the environment to detect or assess problems and progress. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Document Use
Description: Reading, understanding, retaining, and using relevant information from texts, numbers, symbols, graphics, and images in electronic or paper format.

Name: Information Synthesis
Description: Gather information from multiple sources into a coherent whole and summarize it.

Name: Comparing
Description: Determining the functional or structural characteristics of data, people, or things by finding similarities and differences from a model or established standards.

Name: Analyzing Data or Information
Description: Identifying the underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Developing Technical Instructions
Description: Providing documentation, detailed instructions, drawings, or specifications to tell others about how devices, parts, equipment, or structures are to be fabricated, constructed, assembled, modified, maintained, or used. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Clerical Activities
Description: Entering, transcribing, recording, storing, or maintaining all types of information in written or electronic form. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Identifying Objects, Actions, and Events
Description: Identifying information by categorizing, recognizing differences or similarities, measuring, investigating, and detecting changes in circumstances or events. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Estimating the Quantifiable Characteristics
Description: Estimating cost, resources or materials needed to perform a work activity. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Inspecting Equipment, Structures, or Material
Description: Inspecting equipment, structures, or material to identify the cause of errors, problems or defects. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Processing Information
Description: Compiling, categorizing, tabulating, auditing, or verifying information or data. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Physically-Oriented Activities
Description: The physical activities that are performed, equipment and vehicles that are operated, or any other technical activities accomplished to meet the requirements of the job.

Name: Performing Physical and Manual Work Activities
Handling and Moving Objects
Description: Using hands and arms to install, fabricate and, repair objects; or to move or manipulate objects and materials (excluding construction occupations). This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Operating Vehicles, Mechanized Devices, or Equipment
Description: Manoeuvring, navigating, or driving vehicles or mechanized equipment, such as forklifts, passenger vehicles, aircraft, or watercraft. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Constructing
Description: Joining building materials into a structure, applying interior or exterior finishes or installing building systems according to specifications and plans.

Name: Controlling Machines and Processes
Description: Using mechanisms or physical activity to control the operation of machines or processes (excluding computers or vehicles). This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Manipulating - Operating
Description: Using hand-held and power tools or special devices to move, remove, guide, install and place objects or materials.

Name: Sorting
Description: Handling, retrieving, sorting, separating, or arranging materials or information, according to established patterns or procedures.

Name: Catering
Description: Preparing or cooking food and beverage by combining ingredients.

Name: Performing Janitorial Services
Description: Cleaning and maintaining commercial, public, or private places.

Name: Performing General Physical Activities
Description: Performing physical activities that require use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling materials. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Debugging and Reprogramming
Description: Modifying systems through upgrading, amending procedures, or correcting faults.

Name: Artistic Designing
Description: Creating and designing artistic drawing and visual representation, and arranging displays, exhibits or decorations.

Name: Electronic Maintenance
Description: Servicing, repairing, calibrating, regulating, fine-tuning, or testing machines, devices, and equipment that operate on electrical or electronic principles. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Interacting with Computers
Description: Using computers and computer systems (including hardware and software), and equipment with digital interface to program, write software, set up functions, enter data, process information, or control machines. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Mechanical Maintenance
Description: Servicing, repairing, adjusting, or testing machines, devices, moving parts, and equipment that operate on mechanical principles. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Writing or Composing
Description: Writing or composing original material using symbols such as letters of the alphabet or musical notation to communicate thoughts and ideas in a readable or audible form.

Name: Mental Process-Oriented Activities
Description: The processing, planning, problem solving, and decision-making activities that are necessary for the overall completion of a job.

Name: Judging Quality
Description: Assessing the value, importance or quality of materials, products, services or people. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance
Description: Using relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations or standards. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Calculating
Description: Performing, interpreting, and reporting mathematical operations as part of work tasks.

Name: Making Decisions
Description: Choose the best solution based on the analysis of information and the evaluation of potential results. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Thinking Creatively
Description: Generating innovative or creative ideas to develop or design new application, products, including artistic contributions. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Developing Objectives and Strategies
Description: Define and establish medium to long-term objectives, and determine strategies and actions to achieve them. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Applying New Knowledge
Description: Keep up-to-date on relevant theorical and technical knowledge and apply them at work. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Examining and Diagnosing
Description: Assessing the human, animal, technical, or scientific dimensions of a problem through examination or diagnostic testing in order to determine its root cause and appropriate intervention (excluding all forms of interviews).

Name: Managing Resources
Description: Determining, acquiring, monitoring and controlling any kind of resources and overseeing the spending of money. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Planning and Organizing
Description: Developing specific goals and plans to prioritize and organize tasks to get the work done. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Scheduling Work and Activities
Description: Scheduling events, programs, and activities, as well as the work of others. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: People-Oriented Activities
Description: The activities where social interaction with others is necessary to meet the requirements of the job.

Name: Communicating with Coworkers
Description: Sharing or providing information or advice to management, supervisors, co-workers and subordinates on work related topics. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Coordinating the Work and Activities of Others
Description: Getting members of a group to work together to accomplish tasks. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Facilitating Group Discussion
Description: Encouraging exchanges by facilitating participation in group interviews and discussions to improve dialogue, decision making or problem solving.

Name: Interpreting the Meaning of Information for Others
Description: Translating or explaining what information means and how it can be used. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Protecting and Enforcing
Description: Responding to public safety, security and cybersecurity needs, and promoting and ensuring compliance to rules, standards or laws to protect the general population from all kinds of significant danger (excluding medical treatments).

Name: Communicating with Persons Outside Organization
Description: Sharing or exchanging information with people outside the organization, representing the organization to customers, the public, government or other external sources. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Establishing and Maintaining Interpersonal Relationships
Description: Developing respectful, constructive, and cooperative working relationships with others, and maintaining them over time. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Selling or Influencing Others
Description: Convincing others to buy goods or services, or to change their minds or actions. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Performing for or Working Directly with the Public
Description: Working or interacting directly with the public or performing for public audiences. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Interviewing
Description: Conduct formal interviews with individual or group to collect information or opinions (excluding interviews for the purpose of staffing or recruitment).

Name: Assisting and Caring for Others
Description: Providing personal assistance, medical attention, emotional support, or other care to customers, clients, or patients. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Coaching and Developing Others
Description: Identifying the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Providing Consultation and Advice
Description: Providing guidance and expert advice to management or other groups on technical, systems, or process related topics. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Resolving Conflicts and Negotiating with Others
Description: Handling complaints, settling disputes, and resolving grievances and conflicts, or otherwise negotiating with others. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Supervising Subordinates
Description: Provide guidance and direction to subordinates, including the establishment of work outcomes for performance monitoring. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Team Building
Description: Encouraging and building mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Training and Teaching
Description: Identifying the educational needs of others, developing formal educational or training programs or classes, and teaching or instructing others. This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.

Name: Staffing
Description: Recruiting, interviewing, selecting, hiring, and promoting employees in an organization (excluding non-recruitment interviews). This descriptor is measured by complexity level on a scale of 1-5.
